title: Active Listening: The Rarest Skill
description: A quick, practical guide to Active Listening: The Rarest Skill.

hook.text: Most people don't listen to understand. They listen to reply. The difference changes every conversation.

buildup.text: Active listening means fully concentrating, understanding, responding, and then remembering what was said.

discovery.text: Carl Rogers, the psychologist, found that active listening alone resolves most interpersonal conflicts.

twist.text: We think at 400 words per minute but speak at 125. The gap is where our mind wanders.

punchline.text: The best communicators talk less and hear more.

quiz.question: What did psychologist Carl Rogers find about active listening?
options: It alone resolves most interpersonal conflicts
